learning_objectives.description: Understand that a network interface card (NIC) is needed to access a network.
learning_objectives.notes_and_guidance: A NIC is required for a device to connect to a network.

learning_objectives.description: Understand the purpose and structure of a MAC address.
learning_objectives.notes_and_guidance: NICs are assigned a MAC address during manufacture. MAC addresses use hexadecimal and have manufacturer and serial codes.

description: (a) Understand the purpose of an Internet Protocol (IP) address.
(b) Know different types of IP addresses.
learning_objectives.notes_and_guidance: IP addresses can be static or dynamic. Understand characteristics/differences between IPv4 and IPv6.

learning_objectives.description: Describe the role of a router in a network.
learning_objectives.notes_and_guidance: A router sends data to a destination, can assign IP addresses, and connects local networks to the Internet.
